availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas J. Fulgham (Graves County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Henry Fulgham and Ann Fulgham. Married to Louisa H. Smith Fulgham on May 19, 1855. School teacher in Graves County in 1850. Farmer in Graves County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, District 2, p. 374. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 76. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, Mayfield, p. 16. _ Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records â€“ Microfilm (1852-1910)_, Graves County, Marriages, 1855, p. 2, Microfilm rolls #994027-994058, Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky.
